Below you will find information that might help you understand how to find things or learn about information you might need to know about your city or town.

City Council
------------

* ### How do I contact the Mayor?

  The most convenient and practical method of reaching your mayor is by e-mail at
  [shawnt@ci.sherman.tx.us](mailto:shawnt@ci.sherman.tx.us)
  . You may also reach him through the City Manager’s Office at 903-892-7201.

  City Council
* ### Which City Council Member serves my district and how do I make contact?

  The City is divided into four districts, with a Council member elected to represent the residents of that district. There are seven members elected to the Sherman City Council. The Mayor and six Council members are elected from the City at large. All serve three-year terms. To find out who your district Council representative is, contact the City Manager’s Office or the City Clerk’s Office. A map of the City Council district boundaries and contact information for City Council members is also available
  here
  .

  City Council
* ### When and where is the next City Council meeting?

  Regular meetings are held in the City Council Chambers of City Hall located at 220 W Mulberry St in Sherman on the first and third Mondays of each month, except on holidays, beginning at 5:00 pm. All City Council meetings are open to the public.

  During this meeting, the City Council welcomes public comment

  on agenda items listed under the Open Meeting portion of the agenda, in accordance with Texas Government Code Section 551.007.  For items not listed on the agenda, those matters may be discussed with City staff during regular business hours, or with the Mayor or any Council member by contacting them at times other than at City Council meetings.

  City Council
* ### Where can I find the agenda for the next City Council meeting?

  The City Manager prepares an agenda for every City Council meeting. Meeting agendas are available on Thursday afternoons prior to the date of the meeting in the City Clerk's Office, posted on the bulletin board outside City Hall, and published to the City's

  City Council
